SENT.plain: Three cases of hepatic involvement in antiphospholipid syndrome are described
One patient had catastrophic antiphospholipid syndrome with haemorrhages and necrosis in the liver parenchyma
The second patient had blood clots in the small hepatic vessels
The third patient had autoimmune hepatitis type I associated with antiphospholipid syndrome
Other possible hepatic manifestations of antiphospholipid syndrome are also discussed
